text: If you have "AttributeError: 'Positions' object has no attribute 'itervalues'"   Change itervalues() -> values()   Then it should work.

author: @simonchan2394
text: Also,  you are just passing a dictionary of columns into the Pipeline for 'sentiment', 'longs', and 'shorts'. In the my_rebalance portion of the code, you are only pulling the 'longs' and 'shorts' out of the context for your calculations but we do not pull out the 'sentiment' to use for anything at all so my question is why pass the 'sentiment' as a column into your pipeline in the first place if we do not use it?

author: @simonchan2394
text: Hi Harrison, in your backtest2, you have created 3 columns in your pipeline. One is sentiment_quantiles and the other two are sentiment_factors >=4 and sentiment_factors <=2 to get your "improved" results. I thought we would have to pass consistent variables to the pipeline, therefore, I would have passed sentiment_factors >=4, sentiment_factors <= 2, sentiment_factors, instead of sentiment_quantiles.

text: Really love the content!  One question: is the sentiment_quantiles used anywhere at all? What difference does it make here (vs. not defining it)?
